text: Bottle share from Rick. Also had a small sample at the brewery last week. Dark brown pour, small ring of head. Aroma leads with the rum notes from the barrel aging. Taste is nice and full, big and boozy. One of my favorite styles, done well, and nicely embellished by the rum barrels.

22oz bottle thanks to Rick. Pours out cola brown topped with a sand head. Nose is spice rum barrel booze some oxidation along with a belg sugar. Taste is more of the nice malt rum barrel notes some nice booze.

Bottle 22fl.oz. at [ Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Tasting ] @ Deansos place (former ABC Beers), Korte Koediefstraat 5 Den Haag, Netherlands 2511CE. [ As Deschutes Pub Reserve Series: Rum Wowzenbock ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, bread, sugary, buzzy, alcohol - rum. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, buzzy, rum, sweet malt, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. Did not find much weizenbock aroma or flavor, but nice anyway ! [20160922]
 7-4-8-4-16
Bottle: Dark brown with a tan ring head. Brown sugar aroma with a sweet flavor of pitted fruit and a tangy aftertaste. It was my pleasure to drink this!

[9/22/16] Bottle sample at Pre-Borefts RateBeer Tasting at ABC Beers in Den Haag. Thanks everyone for sharing bottles! Brown. Aroma of vanilla, wood, caramel, cookie note, fruity esters, a bit of alcohol. Sweet and slightly tart flavor, fruity, caramelly, woody. Medium-bodied, rounded. Good.

Bottle shared at Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Tasting 2016. Dark mahogany pour, clear, with a tan head. Notes of cherries, sherry, caramel, toffee, macerated fruit, vanilla, oak. Smooth texture, medium to full body with a bitter-sweet finish.

Bottle shared at Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Tasting 2016. Hazy brown With a ring tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt,boozy barrel, oak, vanilla and toffee. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Light full bodied with soft carbonation. [22-09-2016]

Thank you Benzai. 650 ml. bottle sampled @ Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Tasting 2016. Black, mocha head. Nose is a bit empty, molasses, warming boozy syrup with sticky rum but largely hollow. Taste is warming alcoholic dark berries, fizzy, quite empty tasting, molasses, strangely hollow with a quite boozy finish. Body is hollow boozy syrup; expected more richness from this one, bit of a letdown.

Bottle shared @ Borefts Pre-tasting. Dark brown color, average sized off-white to beige head. Aroma is malts, sweet malts, dark sugar, rum. Taste malts, sweet malts, rum, raisins, alcohol bitter finish, dark fruits. Heavy warming alcohol in the finish. Nice to sip a glass, but a full bottle I think is way too much.

Bottle. Brown color with tan head. Aroma is sugar beet, vanilla, rum. Taste is more sugar, a bit tart fruits. Full-bodied. I like this, although its very sweet and is not a Weizenbock in terms of flavour at all.

Sampled @ Pre-Borefts-Tasting 2016. Trübes dunkel orange braunes Bier mit geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen roten Früchten, holzig, bourbon. Geschmack intensiv malzig, rote reife Früchte, leicht rauchig, alkoholisch.

Bottle at Pre-Borefts tasting. Hazy mahogany with beige head. Rum, sour red berries, soft milk chocolate, raisins, marzipan, grape skins. Over medium sweet, under medium sour and light bitter. Medium bodied with a bit fizzy carbonation and some alcohol.
Der malzige Beginn zeigt bereits deutliche Rumaromen. Schnell süßer werdend, was aber nie übertrieben daherkommt, leicht hefig. Moderat fruchtig, vollmundig. 10/8/11/11/11/11
Bottle at pre borefts 2016... Deep brown.. Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet toffee fruit nose... Herbal toffee fruit nose... Big herbal fruit big boozy finish

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 Bottle shared at the pre Borefts tasting.
Thin white head. Hazy amber pour. Rum aftertaste. Very smooth. Very good.
Bottle shared by JeemStot hazy deep redish brown Sweet smooth pitted fruit flavors. Brown sugar raisins plums and some banana and bubble gum from the yeast. Luxurious.

Bottle at Luis Wine Bar share. Pours a deep clear brown with no head. Aroma is rum for days and light caramel. Taste is one of the most well rounded rum barrel aged beers Ive had. Light charred oak, vanilla and a not hot rum finish.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Had right after Murder in the Rye.
More unique. Rum and wheat yeast combine for a sweet and spicy treat. Vanilla, booze, wood, spice. Crazy complex and strong sipper. Wish I have had the base as a point of comparison.
@ Deschutes 16-3-10: Tydlig smak och doft av fat och russin samt rom och torkat frukt.
On tap at the Brewpub in Portland. Brownish with a minimal head. Sweet with dried fruit, rum, oak, caramel and some nuts. Some warming alcohol in the finish. A beer to sip.

On tap at the brewery in PDX. Pours a clear red brown color with a medium white head. A huge sugary boozy nose. The flavor is big rum, spicy, flavorful, light toast, some brown sugar and a fruity sweet base. This is awesome. Just so smooth and surprising to me. Awesome!
